thread.title: Ole Miss Student Senate votes to remove #MSflag
thread.title_full: Ole Miss Student Senate votes to remove #MSflag

author: Frank Corder
title: Ole Miss Student Senate votes to remove #MSflag
text: The Flag Vote at Ole Miss: Student Senate Votes For Removal The state flag has been voted down by the student senate at Ole Miss. On a vote of 33 to 15, the senate passed a resolution calling for the removal of the flag from being flown over campus buildings. The Daily Mississippian, the student-run newspaper on campus, reported that the resolution will now go to the Student Body Pres. Rod Bridges to be signed. It will then go to the dean of students for a review by the administration. The student senate does not have the authority to remove the flag, but the administration may choose to act on their recommendation. NewsMS Posted October 21, 2015 - 7:04 am YallPolitics.Com now uses Facebook for comments. Log into Facebook to comment here.
